Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the academic achievements of the student-athletes by comparing them to prestigious institutions like Notre Dame and Stanford.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that the academic achievements of the student-athletes at the University of Miami are on par with Notre Dame and Stanford.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that mentioning the academic achievements of student-athletes in the same breath as Notre Dame and Stanford is an accurate comparison, without considering other factors such as graduation rates and academic success.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for why the academic achievements of student-athletes at the University of Miami are mentioned in the same breath as Notre Dame and Stanford, such as reputation or public perception, rather than actual academic performance.
